Top Candidate Title: A categorical invariant of flow equivalence of shifts
Summary: This paper introduces a categorical invariant for the flow equivalence of shifts, a central problem in symbolic dynamics. The invariant is constructed using the Karoubi envelope (or idempotent completion) of the syntactic semigroup associated with the shift's language. The Karoubi envelope is a universal construction that ensures all idempotents split, directly addressing the signature of nested idempotents (A). By applying this categorical completion to an object derived from a dynamical system (the shift), the work demonstrates a clear instance of a dynamics-induced completion (B). The authors prove that this Karoubi envelope is, up to natural equivalence, an invariant of flow equivalence, which is a stronger result than previous invariants. Furthermore, they show that this invariant is the "best possible syntactic invariant" for flow equivalence of sofic shifts. The study establishes a deep connection between category theory, specifically idempotent completion, and the classification of dynamical systems.
